intro: Corchorus brachycarpos, commonly known as the short-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, arid environments and has small, narrow leaves. It produces clusters of greenish-yellow flowers, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Corchorus brachycarpos is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
